com.birbit.android.jobqueue

Class Params

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.birbit.android.jobqueue.Params

  • public class Params
extends java.lang.Object
    Job builder object to have a more readable design. Methods can be chained to have more readable code.

        this

      • requireUnmeteredNetworkWithTimeout

        public Params requireUnmeteredNetworkWithTimeout(long timeoutMs)
        Sets the Job as requiring a unmetered network connection with the given timeoutMs. The Job will not be run until a network connection is detected. If timeoutMs is not FOREVER, the Job will be available to run without an unmetered connection if it cannot be run with unmetered network connection in the given time period.

        If you want the job to require unmetered network for a limited time then fall back to metered network, you can do so by requireUnmeteredNetworkWithTimeout(timeout).requireNetwork(). You can even specify a timeout for the unmetered connection as well if you wish the job to be run if enough time passes and no desired network is available.

        Parameters:
        timeoutMs - The timeout in milliseconds after which the Job will be run even if there is no unmetered connection.
        Returns:
        The Params

      • requireNetworkWithTimeout

        public Params requireNetworkWithTimeout(long timeoutMs)
        Sets the Job as requiring a network connection with the given timeoutMs. The Job will not be run until a network connection is detected. If timeoutMs is not FOREVER, the Job will available to run without a network connection if it cannot be run in the given time period.

        In case this timeout is set to a value smaller than requireUnmeteredNetworkWithTimeout(long), the unmetered network timeout will override this one.

        Parameters:
        timeoutMs - The timeout in milliseconds after which the Job will be run even if there is no network connection.
        Returns:
        The Params

      • groupBy

        public Params groupBy(java.lang.String groupId)
        Sets the group id. Jobs in the same group are guaranteed to execute sequentially.
        Parameters:
        groupId - which group this job belongs (can be null of course)
        Returns:
        this

      • singleInstanceBy

        public Params singleInstanceBy(java.lang.String singleId)
        Sets the single instance id. If there is another Job with the same single id queued and not yet running, this Job will get Job.onCancel(int, Throwable) called immediately after Job.onAdded() and only the previous Job will run. That is, Job.onRun() will only be called once.

        If no group id was set, one will be set automatically.

        Parameters:
        singleId - which single instance group this job belongs to (can be null of course)
        Returns:
        this

      • persist

        public Params persist()
        Marks the job as persistent. Make sure your job is serializable.
        Returns:
        this

      • setRequiresUnmeteredNetwork

        public Params setRequiresUnmeteredNetwork(boolean requiresUnmeteredNetwork,
                                          long timeout)
        Convenience method to set unmetered network requirement.
        Parameters:
        requiresUnmeteredNetwork - true|false
        timeout - The timeout(ms) after which Job should be run without checking unmetered network status. If requiresUnmeteredNetwork is false, this value is ignored.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        setRequiresUnmeteredNetwork(boolean), requireUnmeteredNetwork()

        Parameters:
        requiresUnmeteredNetwork - true|false
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:

      • getRequiresNetworkTimeoutMs

        public long getRequiresNetworkTimeoutMs()
        Returns when the Job's network requirement will timeout.
        • If the job does not require network, it will return NEVER.
        • If the job should never be run without network, it will return FOREVER.
        • Otherwise, it will return the timeout in ms until which the job should require network to be run and after that timeout it will be run regardless of the network requirements.
        Returns:
        The network requirement constraint

      • getRequiresUnmeteredNetworkTimeoutMs

        public long getRequiresUnmeteredNetworkTimeoutMs()
        Returns when the Job's UNMETERED network requirement will timeout.
        • If the job does not require UNMETERED network, it will return NEVER.
        • If the job should never be run without UNMETERED network, it will return FOREVER.
        • Otherwise, it will return the timeout in ms until which the job should require network to be run and after that timeout it will be run regardless of the UNMETERED network requirements. It may still be requiring a network connection via requireNetwork() or requireNetworkWithTimeout(long)
        Returns:
        The network requirement constraint

      • setRequiresNetwork

        public Params setRequiresNetwork(boolean requiresNetwork,
                                 long timeout)
        Convenience method to set network requirement.

        In case this timeout is set to a value smaller than requireUnmeteredNetworkWithTimeout(long), the unmetered network timeout will override this one.

        Parameters:
        requiresNetwork - True if Job should not be run without a network, false otherwise.
        timeout - The timeout after which Job should be run without checking network status. If requiresNetwork is false, this value is ignored.
        Returns:
        The params
        See Also:
        setRequiresNetwork(boolean), requireNetwork()
